JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He was represented before the Court by Mr P. de Goederen , a lawyer practising in Bad Ischl . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Ambassador PERSON , Head of ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant was interviewed at the ORG ( ORG and on an unspecified date preliminary investigations ( FAC ) were instituted against the applicant and CARDINAL others . They were suspected of continuous aggravated fraud under LAW ( schwerer gewerbsmässiger Betrug ) by setting up and managing a gambling system which was based on a pyramid scheme . According to the report , the players were formally partners or employees of companies managed by the co - accused and had to pay a certain sum in order to obtain a place on the list of players . The money was used to participate in national lotteries .
On DATE the public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment .
On an unspecified date the case was remitted to the investigating judge and the preliminary proceedings were reopened .

DATE and DATE CARDINAL of the co - accused lodged several requests for the acceleration of the proceedings ( Fristsetzungsantrag ) under LAW of LAW ( GPE - organisationsgesetz ) . In particular he requested that ORG be ordered to hold a hearing , which was of no avail .
The main proceedings started on DATE before ORG .
On DATE the ORG decided to separate those parts of the proceedings which concerned GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE , for reasons of procedural expediency .
ORG , on DATE , rejected the applicant ’s complaint against this decision , holding that such complaints could only be raised in a plea of nullity once the proceedings were terminated .

On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of continuous aggravated fraud and sentenced him to imprisonment of DATE . However , it held that the applicant was not involved in the creation of the pyramid scheme and the sentence was therefore suspended on probation for DATE .

The applicant appealed against the judgment in so far as the sentence was concerned . ORG lodged a plea of nullity and an appeal against this judgment . The co - accused also lodged a plea of nullity . On DATE ORG withdrew the plea of nullity but maintained the appeal .

On DATE the applicant lodged a LAW request , which was dismissed on DATE . ORG held , furthermore , that the proceedings concerning GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE could not be continued until the decision on ORG appeal was taken .
ORG , on DATE , rejected the co - accuseds’ plea of nullity and referred the case to ORG to decide on their and ORG appeal .

On DATE ORG considered the appeals against ORG judgement of DATE . It partly granted the applicant ’s appeal against sentence . It found that the proceedings including the appeal proceedings had lasted unreasonably long and that taking this excessive duration into account the sentence imposed on the applicant had to be reduced . While the offence of continuous aggravated fraud under LAW carried a minimum sentence of DATE imprisonment , ORG , applying LAW , which allowed for an extraordinary reduction of a sentence under special circumstances , reduced the applicant ’s sentence to DATE suspended on probation for a period of DATE .
On DATE the ORG informed the applicant that the proceedings on the charges against him concerning GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE , separated from the main proceedings on DATE , had been discontinued .
